name: monkey-of-death
text:
I try this like once a week and it never works. >:(

This is the first time I noticed "Eyes may close in transit - there is no technology to guard against this." on this strip though and its pretty awesome.

name: songbirdspectre
text: A comment left by songbirdspectre was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by RaysDangNachos, Overmedicated, Thorfinn, cmjhogan, twoshark, TheLoneliestMonkey, antecen, mrsmuckles, clembot, Doc_Rostov, STUART)

text: That was TEODOR. HEATHEN.

name: songbirdspectre
text: ah shit.

name: farqussus
text: His/your wish has come true, songbirdspectre

name: songbirdspectre
text: oh god. you're right.

name: tripperday
text: If only. The Meg White sex tape is a fake.

name: boredom_man
text: Go away, Meg White.

name: nek314
text: A comment, a year later: my wife hates the White Stripes, but loves the Raconteurs. We talked about it and chalked it up to her irrational hatred of Meg White, little though she contributes to the band. I mena, she's a barely servicable drummer and should never be allowed to sing again, but come on, that's hardly reason to hate the woman. But my wife persists. Weird.

name: nek314
text: "I mean"... chalk it up to imbibement.

name: farqussus
text: All wives hate other women. Other women are potentially rooting their husbands.

name: anzio
text: I am looking forward to the day I meet a woman who worries other women want to steal me from her. I say this because it would be a completely unnecessary fear. I am unattractive to most if not all women, there is no need to worry.

name: rowboat
text: Meg White? A "barely serviceable drummer?" I don't mean to be confrontational (and it bears mentioning that I'm not even a big fan of theirs), but you don't know how to listen to drums. You're one of those people who make Ringo jokes, aren't you?

name: rowboat
text:
OK, that came out as more adversarial that I'd intended. It's just a sore subject for me. All I'm trying to say is that White's style is incredible tasteful, which can often be misinterpreted as simplistic. What most non-drummers don't realize is that playing tastefully is in reality much more difficult that playing flashily. It requires restraint which, unlike "chops," is something that cannot be taught. It must be learned.

A tasteful player is selfless. They're doing what they do strictly in the service of the song. A flashy player often doesn't care about the music. They're playing the way they do just to look good personally, which is fucking gross.

That's all.

name: neonfreon
text: serviceable means fuckable, you should relax

name: rowboat
text: I'll relax when you've finished servicing me. And for fuck's sake, cover your teeth with your lips. You act like you've never done this before.

name: duperando
text:
so so true. One of my friends is a stellar guitarist, and many people think he is the best guitarist in the band he plays in (which has a couple of guitarists that rotate per song). One person explained the reasoning well: "He knows when to not play."
And we all know the old adage "Less is more".

name: rowboat
text: Words for all non-metal musicians to live by. Metal musicians get a free pass. They should be busting their balls at all times.

name: rowboat
text:
Also:
Quote:
restraint...is something that cannot be taught. It must be learned.

Not sure I thought that sentence out too well.

name: woodenteeth
text: I've watched a number of songs be completed after having our drummer reign our guitarists in, turning weird Battles like riffs into some punishing yet interesting rock. He's the man of playing what's necessary. In short: I agree.

name: farqussus
text: Conversely, Bloc Party sucked once the drummer had his near death experience and stopped playing his furious fills and crisp metronomic rhythms.

name: woodenteeth
text: Strike me down if he wasn't the man that saved that band from the infinite hole of blanddom.

name: farqussus
text: Keep an eye over your shoulder for Kele Okerekerekerekerekerekerekerererekkerkerkekrekreke

name: woodenteeth
text: Now there's a man I can't bring myself to fear. Not even in my imaginations.

name: anzio
text: Not all metal guitarists believe in this. Most of us in the stoner metal or doom genre also believe in a less is more kind of deal. It's about the song and the sound, not the pointless self-indulgences. Although sometimes it is also totally about the pointless self-indulgences, just in different ways.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Man, all them words that was like a 15 minute drum solo right there.


but tasteful, mind you

text: That technology is known and it is called tape.

name: kingcrimson
text: I tried typing it in on Google, just now. I figured if e-bay doesn't understand it, maybe the entire internet does. Asking the Internet for the best thing it has, that is the kind of thinking that builds mountains. You know where it led me? Right here, this page. Google knows what the best thing on the internet is

name: never_die
text: the kind of thinking that builds mountains and then drags pictures of motorcycles over them.

name: razorman57
text: YES!!! how come i was the only one to chubby you?

http://billionairexchange.com/

text:
re: comment above this one,
Right after this strip ran there was a few hits when you searched for WHATS THE BEST THING YOU GOT on eBay. I think it was like a half eaten bag of pretzels though, far from the best thing on eBay.

name: mrshl
text: I did the same thing. I think I also searched on Google, hoping there was a Google bomb type thing. No such luck.

name: hamscout
text:
Search on 04/13/08 leads to: this sad item.
Far less cool than Airwolf. Santini wouldn't drink a free beer outta that thing...

text: I came here to post something like this. We see three items on the screen, and Ray bought at least two of them. I like to think Onstad is keeping the laser in reserve.

text:
Okay, I just noticed the cardboard box marked 3' in the back of Airwolf in the next strip.

Awesome.

text: I must say, if you change the word gargantuan to genitalia, then would it deserve hella 5s.

text: ...so I figure it's $20mil for Airwolf, and the odd $100k for the Jan Michael Vincent meet and greet

name: sherwood
text: the problem is that I'm just givin' out all 5s here.  I have no standards when it comes to Achewood.  I'm like a 15 year old at the pool.

name: digdugz
text:
I feel the same exact way.

I've ended up just giving all strips a 4 and then using the rating of 5 as a favorites list.

name: werthog42
text: Well, you are getting lots of chubbies, which certainly reinforces the comparison.

name: onepapertiger
text:
I want to chubby this but I've never seen the impressive lot of exactly 50 chubbies anywhere else on Assetbar.
V-chub, out of a watered-down attack of OCD.

name: semiquaver
text: Well you could have chubbied it to create the inverse effect of a 15 year old with 51 chubbies.  But it's too late now.  Someone--not me--upset the balance.  So go ahead.  Chubby.

name: molesticide
text:
i should make omelettes.

[nobody is around]

i should go to sleep.

[get stoned]

i should get on ebay!

[poor organization]

i wonder what is the best thing the internet can do for me?

[drops a wad]

this is what i will be like when i'm richer than FUCK like ray is.

in the grand tradition of ray and robert johnson, i hereby offer to sell my soul to the devil for some MAD beat-boxing skills. you hear me, luke? i'm serious!

text: This is the most inventive thing I have ever read.

text:
"kids, always sleep stoned."
four words to live by.

name: fuzzyshoo
text: I haven't smoked in almost 5 years. If it's one pleasure I do miss, it is sleeping stoned. I'd always wake up so refreshed and ready to take on any challenge the new day brought, but I'd always poop a lot because I had eaten something like a Pillsbury french bread loaf and butter sandwich the night before.

name: unclejam
text: Goddamn, Ray has that much money?

name: falseprophet
text: eBay is not the only prominent web site that uses cheat codes to reward A-type personalities. I went to facebook and typed in "I SEE SOME LADIES TONITE THAT SHOULD BE HAVING MY BABY, BABY" and I found out I was in an open relationship with Halle Berry.

name: zem
text: two years later you were fatally shot mere weeks before the release of your second album

text: That laser is incredibly cheap.

name: drskradley
text: I hadn't noticed that, but now you mention it, it is.  That's not much at all for a Death Ray.  They're just giving those damn things away these days.

name: rateoforange
text: I imagine the laser is actually pretty weak. It's just wide, you know.

name: drskradley
text: But that'll blind EVERYBODY.  And all the women will want to know me.

name: lamelliform
text:
This, in my mind, is classic Achewood.

I work for eBay, and I've got this strip tacked to my cubicle wall.

name: professorhazard
text: There are cubicles at eBay? What for?

name: tekende
text: ...Why wouldn't there be?

name: professorhazard
text: I just can't imagine how the company would need more than three or four lanky-haired nerds, especially considering that their customer service is, essentially, nonexistent. Ever tried to e-mail them with a problem? Go on, try to find their contact info! I know people who have debts they can't pay from six years ago because the site won't let them do it.

name: doc_rostov
text:
Two words:

Paperwork, marketing.

name: fineoakstructure
text: That won't help these people pay their debts at all.

name: spicyponyhead
text: Someone's got to make sure you're not selling used panties and horse heads on there.

name: vermy
text: The no body parts rule has always upset me.

name: soticoto
text: Totally hear you.

name: orvel
text: Looks like Keith got fooled again after all.

name: riotdejaneiro
text: It is a perfect...comment/avatar synergy!

name: cherubrocker22
text: Dude, it does suck how they organize that site.

name: hyetal
text:
I loved this strip from the first moment I laid eyes on it. I think it's absolutely brilliant. When I want my friends to get interested in Achewood, I show them this strip... then I realize it won't work because they weren't there , man, like from the beginning and all!

And this is classic Ray, Ray at his absolute best. As eBay itself puts it, he thinks "like the world's greatest." Donald Trump, Bill Gates, Ray Smuckles%u2014they get things done.

But I'm sure Ray's reaction is a little less grand than mine. He probably said "Neat!" and started scratching at the screen to try to take the ones he wanted...

name: unsentletter
text:
Holy crap, I love Ray's facial expression of discovery. It says it all.

Fuck yeah , Airwolf!

text: Big money, big fools, big bore.

text:
Its, The. Biggest. Laser.
Such a laser of its magnitude cannot be contained in a single sentence.

text: Search for "what's the best thing you got" on Amazon, and the third result is the "JL421 Badonkadonk Land Cruiser/Recreational Tank," priced at $19,999.95.  Somehow, it lost to "1974:Billboard Top R&B Hits [Audio Cassette]" and "What in the World Do You Do When Your Parents Divorce? A Survival Guide for Kids."
